briefdescription.para: Default constructor for the MADC config.

detaileddescription.para: The default values are in a usable state, the MADC is connected to the SourceMultiplexerOnReadoutSourceSelection(0). Only the number of samples to record is required to be set.

briefdescription.para: Accessors for the sampling rate of the madc in Hz.

detaileddescription.para:
The calculation considers the following settings of the MADC state:
m_sample_duration_adjust
m_enable_madc_clock_scaling
m_madc_clock_scale_value
madc_base_frequency
Base frequency of the madc, which can be obtained from the ADPLL settings and PLLClockOutputBlock.
Double describing the madc sample rate

briefdescription.para: Set the initially selected input of the active mux.

detaileddescription.para: Caution: the property is called initially_selected_amp in RTL.

briefdescription.para: Set the number of samples the mux's inputs are selected for in direct succession.

detaileddescription.para: In the following example the MADC would record four samples on one input, before the mux switches to the other one: input 0: |||| |||| … input 1: |||| |||| …
Caution: the property is called amp_select_length in RTL.

briefdescription.para: Accessors for the built-in calibration's timing of the MADC.
Configuration for the conversion cycles offset.

detaileddescription.para: This seems to be redundant to sample_duration_adjust. Both settings are summed up in hardware.
Caution: the meaning of this setting was reverse engineered due to a lack of documentation!

briefdescription.para: Accessors for the configuration of the current conversion circuit.

detaileddescription.para: The first property enables the internal amplifier of the circuit. The other properties allow to connect either the direct neuron access or the synaptic debug lines.

briefdescription.para: Accessors for the clock scaling configuration.

detaileddescription.para: The clock is derived from a PLL madc_clk output.

briefdescription.para: Configuration of the MADC's SAR reset timing.
Accessors for the number of samples recorded by the MADC.

detaileddescription.para: The MADC records a fixed number of samples as long as it is not configured to sample continuously (c.f. enable_sample_continously).
Caution: this property is called num_samples in the RTL description.

briefdescription.para: Configuration of the powerup wait value.

detaileddescription.para: This MADC remains in the wake up state for a number of MADC clock cycles determined by this property before transitioning to the READY state (via ENABLE).

briefdescription.para: Accessors for the preamplifier's gain selection capacitor.
Accessors for the timing of the sampling phase for both, the (voltage recording) preamp and the current conversion circuit.

detaileddescription.para: The sampling window is determined by the timing of its rising and falling edge.
Caution: these properties are called phi_vga_toggle[0,1] and phi_2quadrant_toggle[0,1] for the preamp and current conversion, respectively.

briefdescription.para: Accessors for the sample duration adjustment.

detaileddescription.para: This seems to be redundant to conversion_cycles_offset. Both settings are summed up in hardware.
Caution: the property is called sample_adjust in RTL. Caution: the meaning of this setting was reverse engineered due to a lack of documentation!

briefdescription.para: Accessors for the preamp mux located before the preamplifier.

detaileddescription.para: This mux has four (pairs of) inputs: the active mux (for voltage measurements), the current conversion circuit, two debug lines (which might be applied to the chip's pads), and the preamplifier. The first two serve as signal sources, the latter as a sink. The pads may serve as either. To connect two (or more) sources/sinks, the user must connect any of them.
Caution: the respective properties are called fmc_2_quadrant, fmc_act_mux, fmc_debug, and fmc_to_vga.

briefdescription.para: Configuration container for MADC and related circuitry.
